009package imagingbook.common.math.eigen;
010
011import org.apache.commons.math3.linear.MatrixUtils;
012import org.apache.commons.math3.linear.RealMatrix;
013import org.apache.commons.math3.linear.RealVector;
014
015/**
016 * Common interface for eigendecompositions capable of delivering solutions when
017 * all eigenvalues are real.
018 * 
019 * @author WB
020 * @version 2022/07/08
021 */
022public interface RealEigenDecomposition {       // TODO: add 'ComplexEigenDecomposition' interface and implementations
023        
024        /**
025     * Returns whether the calculated eigenvalues are complex or real.
026     *
027     * @return {@code true} if any of the eigenvalues is complex, {@code false} otherwise
028     */
029        public boolean hasComplexEigenvalues();
030        
031        /**
032         * Returns the real part of the k-th eigenvalue
033         * 
034         * @param k index of the eigenvalue @param k index of the eigenvector (0-based)
035         * @return real part of the k-th eigenvalue
036         */
037        public double getRealEigenvalue(int k);
038        
039//      /**
040//       * Returns the imaginary part of the k-th eigenvalue
041//       * @return imaginary part of the k-th eigenvalue
042//       */
043//      public default double getImagEigenvalue(int k) {
044//              throw new UnsupportedOperationException();
045//      }
046        
047        /**
048         * Returns a vector holding the real parts of the eigenvalues
049         * @return real(diag(D))
050         */
051        public double[] getRealEigenvalues();
052        
053//      /**
054//       * Returns a vector holding the imaginary parts of the eigenvalues
055//       * @return imag(diag(D))
056//       */
057//      public default double[] getImagEigenvalues() {
058//              throw new UnsupportedOperationException();
059//      }
060        
061         /**
062     * Returns the k-th eigenvector, i.e., the
063     * k-th column vector of the matrix returned
064     * by {@link #getV()}.
065     * 
066     * @param k index of the eigenvector (0-based)
067     * @return the k-th eigenvector (instance of {@link RealVector})
068     */
069        public RealVector getEigenvector(int k);
070        
071        /**
072         * Return the matrix of eigenvectors, which are its column vectors.
073         * 
074         * @return the matrix of eigenvectors
075         */
076        public RealMatrix getV();
077        
078        
079        /**
080     * Gets the block diagonal matrix D of the decomposition.
081     * Real eigenvalues are on the diagonal while complex values are on
082     * 2x2 blocks {{real pos imaginary}, {neg imaginary, real}}.
083     *
084         * @return matrix D
085         */
086        public default RealMatrix getD() {
087                return MatrixUtils.createRealDiagonalMatrix(getRealEigenvalues());
088        }
089        
090
091}
